name: OpenCL Mid-Level Abstractions
short_description: OCL-MLA defines a mid-level abstraction layer to the OpenCL runtime for applications developers.  One of the primary features of the ocl interface is that it defines a set of logical devices (currently a performance device and an auxiliary device) that are able to run OpenCL C kernels.  Each logical device is created with an associated queue and context, and has a user interface for creating and manipulating data, arguments and timing events.  The current interface is available in C and Fortran.
summary: Mid-level abstraction interface to ease OpenCL development
